channel.title: Suggestions for my client
channel.description:
Hello people of moparscape, i don't often come on here, infact i've only posted 6 times in over 2 years, but i'm desperate for ideas for my client as it will be released to the Dodian community this week. I was wondering if anybody could just read this short thread, flick through the pictures and give me any suggestions that i should change\add to the client. This will be the official client for dodian.com and i really want it as 'perfect' as possible, thanks.
Edit: I now made it so it auto-loads previous logs into the tab when you join a channel, like mIRC - this can be enabled\disabled. Can also now enable\disable logs.
Edit: Made preferences so you can decide wether or not the IRC is maximized when you load the client and If it logs and the location to which it logs.
Edit: New:
[img]http://img66.imageshack.us/img66/518/mp3newestfl6.png[/img] I'll probably add more things to the preferences as i go along.
Here's some of the pics ( I will be updating these, most likely on a daily basis. ) : [IMG]http://img227.imageshack.us/img227/8259/screenie2qm2.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img355.imageshack.us/img355/3726/screeniela7.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img367.imageshack.us/img367/7796/screenie3he8.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img170.imageshack.us/img170/9230/client5el8.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img384.imageshack.us/img384/9656/notepadmf0.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img405.imageshack.us/img405/7456/logsts4.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img212.imageshack.us/img212/2613/logs2nc3.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img385.imageshack.us/img385/2272/screenie4gf8.png[/img]
These are just a few of the pictures of the client.. suggestions would be appreciated.
Thanks.

item.title: Suggestions for my client
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“drags, post:12, topic:210792”]Hmm, good idea mLexus, just don’t know how i’d do that.[/quote]Basic script system. Maybe even with reflection. (java.lang.reflect)

Example Script:

//Name of file: calc.*
author "TeleNubby"
info "Calculator GUI for Dodian Client"
add menu "Calculator"
onclick menu "Calculator"
       load calcMain()
       break
public void calcMain()
{
       JFrame myFrame = new JFrame("Calculator");
       //Rest goes here.
}

Pretty sloppy/crappy example, but it’s just there to show you.

EDIT:
Now for that reflection part I mentioned. Here’s a quick script that would use it:

//Name of file: noirc.*
author "TeleNubby"
info "Disables the use of the IRC addon on the Dodian Client"
load_internal Component_inst("IRCPanel").setEnabled(false);

Now how you would read this in the client would be like so:

String tempData;
try
{
       DataInputStream inStream = new FileInputStream(new DataInputStream("noirc.examplescript"));
       while((tempData = inStream.readLine()) != null)
       {
              if(tempData.startsWith("load_internal"))
              {
                     //Using regex to process and read the line.
                     Pattern myPattern = Pattern.compile("(.+)\\((.+)\\)\\.(.+)\\((.+)*\\)");
                     Matcher myMatcher = myPattern.matcher(tempData.substring(14));
                     if(myMatcher.find())
                     {
                            String theComponent = myMatcher.group(1)+"("+myMatcher.group(2)+")";
                            String theMethod = myMatcher.group(3)+"("+myMatcher.group(4)+")";
                            /**
                            * Value of theComponent is: Component_inst("IRCPanel")
                            * Value of theMethod is: setEnabled(false);
                            * From here on, use reflection to invoke the setEnabled method for the comp.
                            */
                     }
              }
       }
}
catch(Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); }

Ugh. I know its not the best way to do it, but I was sort of out of it when I wrote that. That’s why I also didn’t finish it. Just use reflection to invoke the setEnabled() method for the component’s instance.

Read full topic
